ideogram
Class IdeogramView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              ideogram.IdeogramView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener
public class IdeogramView
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements java.io.Serializable, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.print.Printable

Visual representation of a single ideogram. To show the ideogram a database has to be loaded or attached with IdeogramBean.LoadDatabase or IdeogramBean.setIdeogramDB TODO: Split this component into different view sub-classes for 1. the karyogram 2. the gene markers 3. the different marker lines 4. the SNP markers These different components could be synchronized (i.e. start/stop basepair) and could have their own routines for e.g. showing tooltips.

Author:
muellera
See Also:
Serialized Form

markerToXCoord

public int markerToXCoord(int count)
Compute the x-coordinate of a marker position. If count is > 0 the markers are placed on the right side of the ideogram. If count is < 0 the markers will be on the left side.

Parameters:
count - Maker value.
Returns:
x-coordinate

xCoordToMarker

public int xCoordToMarker(int x)
Converts a x-coordinate in this panel into a marker value.

Parameters:
x -
Returns:
Integer marker value between -n ... n. Returns 0 if the pointer is outside the marker regions
